dublin_core.dcvalue: Since 2010 health care organizations have rapidly adopted telemedicine as part of their health care delivery system to inpatients and outpatients The application of telemedicine in the intensive care unit is often referred to as tele ICU In telemedicine nurses nurse practitioners physicians and other health care professionals provide patient monitoring and intervention from a remote location Tele ICU presence has demonstrated positive outcomes such as increased adherence to evidence based care and improved perception of support at the bedside Despite the successes acceptance of tele ICU varies Known barriers to acceptance include perceptions of intrusiveness and invasion of privacy
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-08T14:31:57Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2-11-30
Bedside Nurse Acceptance of Intensive Care Unit Telemedicine Presence.
